p: Î²-Caryophyllene, a spice (pepper) aroma, is the most available sesquiterpenoid in cannabis plants and extracts, especially after decarboxylation by heat. It is an agonist with the CB2 receptor without psychoactivity [ 52]. It is also responsible for the cannabis anti-inflammatory effects [ 66]. This sesquiterpene is also proven to give gastroprotective, analgesic, anticancerogenic, antifungal, antibacterial, antidepressant, anti-inflammatory, antiproliferative, antioxidant, anxiolytic, analgesic, and neuroprotective effects [ 26]. The caryophyllene oxide that gives the lemon balm-like scent is proven to have anti-fungal and insecticidal properties [ 28].
